description: Specifically, as per comments from Vish on lp718999, auth_get_token and auth_destroy_token are named incorrectly and should be named auth_token_get() and auth_token_destroy() respectively. A fair amount of the OS API auth code and unit tests reference these incorrect names.
title: Incorrect method naming scheme for Auth Token database interactions

comments.content: Specifically, as per comments from Vish on lp718999, auth_get_token and auth_destroy_token are named incorrectly and should be named auth_token_get() and auth_token_destroy() respectively. A fair amount of the OS API auth code and unit tests reference these incorrect names.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~cerberus

comments.content: I think the above is low or wishlist priority. However, I'm not sure whether or not I should be the one to decide that?
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~cerberus

comments.content: is this ONLY the OS API or does the EC2 API also use db.auth_get_token()?
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~jaypipes
